articles.author: Ronen Zvulun
articles.description: Israeli forces gave a small group of foreign reporters a tour of the tunnel that had been uncovered beneath the European Hospital in Khan Younis.
articles.title: Israel reveals tunnel under Gaza hospital, says body of Sinwar's brother found there

articles.author: Jorge Garcia, Arafat Barbakh
articles.description: Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth has warned that the Pentagon was prepared to mobilize active-duty troops "if violence continues" in Los Angeles.
articles.title: National Guard deployed in Los Angeles amid protests against immigration raids

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A vessel that was approaching Freedom Flotilla Coalition's Gaza-bound charity ship the Madleen has left, the coalition said early on Monday, after an alarm was sounded on the ship warning of a possible interception.
articles.title: Freedom Flotilla Coalition says vessel approaching Gaza-bound ship left

articles.author: Krishna N. Das, Sarita Singh
articles.description: April marks the start of the cruelest months for residents of Solapur, a hot and dry district in western India. As temperatures soar, water availability dwindles. In peak summer, the wait for taps to flow can stretch to a week or more.
articles.title: India's $80 bln coal-power boom is running short of water

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A Seoul court said on Monday it will indefinitely postpone a trial of President Lee Jae-myung on charges of violating election law in 2022.
articles.title: South Korea President Lee's election law violation hearing postponed indefinitely, court says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: South Korea's newly-elected President Lee Jae-myung and Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba agreed during a telephone call to strengthen bilateral ties, a South Korean presidential spokesperson and Japan's foreign ministry said on Monday.
articles.title: South Korea President Lee, Japan PM Ishiba agree to strengthen ties

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: China said that by the end of this year all tertiary level hospitals must offer epidural anaesthesia during childbirth, a move it said would help promote a "friendly childbearing environment" for women.
articles.title: China to make all hospitals offer epidurals to incentivise childbirth

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The military said troops fired warning shots at a group that was moving toward soldiers.
articles.title: Israeli military kills 4 near aid distribution site in Gaza, medics say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Production was temporarily suspended at an electronics company in Russia's Volga river region of Chuvashia, some 1,300 km (800 miles) from the border with Ukraine, after two drones fell on the plant's territory, the head of the region said on Monday.
articles.title: Ukraine's drone attack halts work at electronic plant in Chuvashia, Russia says

articles.author: Trevor Hunnicutt
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump's order banning citizens of 12 countries from entering the United States goes into effect at 12:01 am ET (0401 GMT) on Monday, a move the president promulgated to protect the country from "foreign terrorists."
articles.title: Trump's travel ban on 12 countries goes into effect early Monday
